name: Whole Roasted Chicken
description: A flavorful and juicy whole roasted chicken, perfect for a special occasion or a comforting family meal.
instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, onion paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well to coat the chicken evenly.
2. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for 2–4 hours, or overnight.
3. Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
4. In a roasting pan, place the chicken and pour over any remaining marinade.
5. Roast the chicken for 45–60 minutes, turning and basting with the pan juices occasionally.
6. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes before carving and serving.
7. Garnish with cilantro and serve with your favorite sides.
notes: For a crispy skin, roast the chicken at a higher temperature (220°C or 425°F) for the last 15 minutes of cooking.

name: Roasted Chicken
description: A classic Indian dish made with chicken marinated in yogurt and spices.
instructions:
1. Marinate chicken with yogurt, spices, and lemon juice for 2–4 hours.
2. Roast at 200°C (400°F) for 45–60 minutes, turning and basting occasionally.
3. Rest for 10 minutes, garnish with cilantro, and serve hot with naan, rice, or paratha.
notes: This dish can be served with a variety of sides, such as naan, rice, or paratha.

name: Indian Roasted Chicken
description: A flavorful and juicy Indian-style roasted chicken recipe.
instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine chicken, yogurt, spices, and lemon juice. Mix well to coat chicken evenly.
2. Marinate chicken for at least 2 hours, or up to overnight.
3. Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
4. Remove chicken from marinade and place on a baking sheet.
5. Roast chicken for 45-60 minutes, or until cooked through and juices run clear when pierced with a fork.
6. Remove chicken from oven and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
7. Garnish with cilantro and serve with naan, rice, or paratha.
notes: For a more flavorful chicken, marinate it overnight. If you don't have time to marinate the chicken, you can still roast it, but it won't be as juicy. You can also add other vegetables to the roasting pan, such as potatoes, carrots, and onions.

name: Chicken Tandoori
description: A mouthwatering and flavorful Indian dish with juicy, succulent chicken, blended with aromatic spices and grilled to perfection.
instructions:
1. Marinate the chicken in a mixture of yogurt, spices, and lemon juice for 2–4 hours. 
2. Roast the chicken at 200°C (400°F) for 45–60 minutes, turning and basting occasionally. 
3. Rest the chicken for 10 minutes, garnish with cilantro, and serve hot with naan, rice, or paratha.
notes: For a spicier flavor, increase the amount of red chili powder. Serve with your favorite sides, such as naan, rice, or paratha.
